text.content:
The following settings are available in the module settings panel. These settings are world-scoped and apply to all users in the world.

Apply Elevation to Selected

When applying elevation via a token's HUD, apply it to all selected tokens. This is useful for moving a group of tokens to the same elevation at once, such as when the party ascends a staircase or flies to a new height.

Max Ability Score

Sets the maximum ability score a character can have. The default value is 20. Increasing this value allows ability scores to exceed the normal cap, which may be useful for epic-level campaigns or homebrew rules.

Max Level

Sets the maximum character level allowed. The default value is 20. This can be increased for campaigns that extend beyond the standard level range.

Radial Status Effects

When enabled, status effect icons are displayed in a circular layout around the token rather than the default grid layout. Icons are shown with a circular background. This provides a cleaner appearance, especially on tokens with multiple status effects.

Requires a reload when changed.

Ruler Travel Time

When enabled, the measuring tool displays estimated D&D 5e travel time below the distance measurement. Three travel paces are shown:

  • Fast pace — 400 feet per minute, 4 miles per hour, 30 miles per day
  • Normal pace — 300 feet per minute, 3 miles per hour, 24 miles per day
  • Slow pace — 200 feet per minute, 2 miles per hour, 18 miles per day

Travel time uses 8-hour travel days as per the standard D&D 5e rules. Travel time is not displayed during combat. This setting only applies when the grid units are set to feet or miles.

Requires a reload when changed.

Show Pressed Keys

When enabled, an icon appears near the cursor when the Skip Dialog, Advantage, or Disadvantage keys are pressed while hovering over a rollable element such as an attack button or item use button. This provides a visual indicator of the active modifier before clicking.

Requires a reload when changed.

Token Border Shape

Choose the shape of the token's border when it is selected or hovered. Options include circle and square. The default is square, matching the standard Foundry VTT behaviour.

Requires a reload when changed.

Toggle Status Effects on Selected

When toggling a status effect via a token's HUD, toggle it for all selected tokens. This is useful for applying or removing a condition from multiple tokens at once, such as applying the Frightened condition to a group of enemies.

Requires a reload when changed.
